Adjusts quickly to new surroundings in 1989 body, shows a glint of intelligence amid confusing situation.
Finds and obtains Mr. Miller's alcohol despite limited physical strength, showing resourcefulness.
Uses confident and threatening language to intimidate Mr. Miller, demonstrating situational awareness and control.
Tries and fails to open the thermos himself due to physical weakness, a limitation but not due to lack of skill.
Initially flips through journal pages and concludes 'that didn't work', showing willingness to learn but impatience or frustration.
Defiantly lights a match near a dangerous explosive, risking harm to others.
Shows deep emotional pain and sorrow over Kayleigh's presumed death, sobbing uncontrollably and expressing desire to protect her.
Desperately searches for his journals, shows emotional pain over losing them, refuses to give up on their existence.
Collapses lifelessly in despair when confronted with the reality that his journals never existed.
Frantically searches for his journals to find answers and prevent tragedy.
Refuses to accept Dr. Redfield's explanation that the journals never existed and that he may be imagining things.
Collapses lifelessly to the floor when confronted with painful truth, showing physical or mental overwhelm.
Stares out window alone, feeling trapped and hopeless, indicating a lack of confidence or immediate problem solving.
Secretly listens to a difficult conversation without interrupting, showing self-control and emotional awareness.
Calms his mother by changing the subject gently despite the distressing situation, demonstrating situational awareness and empathy.
Breaks open the doctor's office door to gain access, showing determination but also desperation and possible recklessness.
Rips apart file cabinets searching for information, indicating resourcefulness and urgency but potential lack of subtlety.
Wipes nosebleed repeatedly with irritation while continuing his task, indicating physical and mental stamina and focus.
Hides under the desk when guards search the corridor, demonstrating quick thinking and stealth.
Begins writing in shorthand a note explaining his intentions, showing forethought and planning.
Acknowledges fatigue but continues working toward his goal nonetheless, showing perseverance.
Leans over to Kayleigh as if to kiss her but then cruelly whispers a violent threat, hurting her deeply.
Carefully sets up the Super-8 projector and controls the light to avoid spilling it on the wall, showing attention to detail and skill.
Gets lost in the memory projection, appearing emotionally overwhelmed, which may indicate vulnerability but not incompetence.
Slowly approaches Kayleigh at the party, taking in all sensory details, which shows mindfulness and observational skill.
Deliberately chooses to whisper a hostile and cruel statement to Kayleigh, threatening her and her family, resulting in emotional harm.
Ignores the adults reacting to his outburst and fixates on Kayleigh, revealing emotional turmoil and a lack of social tact or emotional regulation.
Declines medical help despite bloody nose but visibly suffers silently
Burns his personal journals and memorabilia with friend Lenny, indicating a willingness to let go of past pain together
Speaks considerately to his mother on the phone, informing her of delay and suggesting she order soup
Notices Kayleigh, takes a hesitant moment and then follows her after she passes by
